pull.title: luke-jr constants
pull.body:
Rebased version of #6349 (2/3).

I have dropped the changes to `src/chainparamsbase.cpp` to only include code that has already been reviewed as part of #6349.

events.body:
Rebased. (Due to the translations cleanup)

@laanwj Is it ok with the gui constants like this?

I don't like including a GUI header from the core. We don't do that anywhere.

I'd prefer moving the part of HelpMessage with GUI specific settings to the GUI code.

> I put them in HelpMessageDialog()

That's awesome. They originally came from there and they shouldn't have been moved. Thanks!

~~ACK~~
Concept ACK, I haven't checked the code changes in detail yet, but needs rebase (again...).

events.message: Constrain constant values to a single location in code
Bugfix: Omit wallet-related options from -help when wallet is not supported

[trivial] Reuse translation and cleanup DEFAULT_* values

* DEFAULT_DISABLE_SAFEMODE = false
* Use DEFAULT_* constants for extern bools
[qt] Move GUI related HelpMessage() part downstream

events.body:
Rebased.

> I haven't checked the code changes in detail yet, but needs rebase (again...).

This needs rebase approximately every 4 days. I checked the code as of #6349 and verified each rebase twice. Though, I don't think constant rebase makes this PR any better.
ACK. Read over all the code changes, and compared the output of bitcoind and bitcoin-qt's --help output.

issue.title: Constrain constant values to a single location in code
Chainparams: Use a regular factory for creating chainparams
issue.body:
This makes it simpler for people to create new testchains in their own branches by removing the need to create a new static global variable for the new chains.

It also prepares chainparams and chainparamsbase to be cleaned out of globals by moving the globals and related functions (`Params(), SelectParams()`, etc) outside, maybe to globals/server.o and globals/common.o respectively.

But that would need another PR after this, something @theuni has been wanting to do for some time.
I would prefer to do this first to be able to leave the 2 factories (which don't need to depend on any global) where they are. 
Part of #6382

issue.title: mapArgs is modified by setgenerate RPC without locking

issue.title: Misc upstream PRs
issue.body:
Cherry-picked from the following upstream PRs:

- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6077
  - Second commit only (first was already applied to 0.11.X and then reverted)
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6284
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6489
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6235
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6905
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6780
  - Excluding second commit (QT) and third commit (requires https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6993)
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6961
  - Excluding QT parts, and a small `src/policy/policy.cpp` change which depends on a bunch of other PRs, which we'll have to remember to come back to.
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7044
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8856
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9002

Part of #2074 and #2132.

issue.title: [Wallet][Refactoring] wallet/init refactoring backports
issue.body:
Adapts the following refactoring PRs:

- bitcoin/bitcoin#6961 Constrain constant values to a single location in code
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7576 [Wallet] move wallet help string creation to CWallet
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7577 move "load wallet phase" to CWallet
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7608 Move hardcoded file name out of log messages
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7691 refactor wallet/init interaction
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8776 Wallet refactoring leading up to multiwallet

comments.body:
I'd prefer to use `DEFAULT_DISABLESAFEMODE = false` then use that instead of negating this everywhere it is used.
(agree that  in retrospect the option should have been called safemode and acted in this way, but there's no way back now, and having this consistent makes it easier to link it to the constant)

It's ugly to have defaults for these GUI specific options in the core, they are not related to util at all.
IMO the help for GUI specific options should be moved to the GUI part of the code.
Agreed, plus if disable wallet is enabled, it'll possibly throw a tonne of unused variable warnings (assuming `-Wnounused`)
@laanwj @dcousens So where would I put those? `qt/guiconstants.h`? Or rather`qt/paymentrequestplus.h`, `qt/intro.h` ...
~~Why do you change this default?~~ ok it isn't changed it was always true
Please define `DEFAULT_*` constant for this, instead of passing through the old value of the global.
Never mind. The fLogTimestamps variable was initialized to false before, but the default setting was true. This makes it more consistent. Good.
